00050 ! ================

00053 
00054   subroutine psrsperm_i4(nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc,array,w1,w2, indxl,irnkl,islen,irlen,fposts,gposts)
00055 
00056     implicit none
00057     include 'mpif.h'
00058 
00059     integer :: nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc
00060 
00061     integer, dimension(nppm) ::  array, w1, w2
00062     integer, dimension(nppm) :: indxl, irnkl
00063     integer, dimension(nprocs) ::  islen, irlen
00064     integer, dimension(nprocs+1) :: fposts, gposts
00065 
00066     integer :: i,ierr
00067 
00068     do i=1,np
00069        w1(i) = array(indxl(i))
00070     enddo
00071 
00072     call MPI_ALLTOALLV(  w1, islen, fposts, MPI_INTEGER, &
00073                          w2, irlen, gposts, MPI_INTEGER, &
00074                          MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00075 
00076     do i=1,npnew
00077        array(irnkl(i)) = w2(i)
00078     enddo
00079 
00080   end subroutine psrsperm_i4

00123 
00124 
00125     implicit none
00126     include 'mpif.h'
00127 
00128     integer :: nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc
00129 
00130     real*8, dimension(nppm) ::  array, w1, w2
00131     integer, dimension(nppm) ::  indxl, irnkl
00132     integer, dimension(nprocs) ::  islen, irlen
00133     integer, dimension(nprocs+1) :: fposts, gposts
00134 
00135 
00136     integer :: i,ierr
00137

00140        w1(i) = array(indxl(i))
00141     enddo
00142 
00143 
00144     call MPI_alltoallv(  w1,islen, fposts, MPI_REAL8, &
00145          w2, irlen, gposts, MPI_REAL8, &
00146          MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00147

00149        array(irnkl(i)) = w2(i)
00150     enddo
00151 
00152   end subroutine psrsperm_r8

00158 ! unweighted || sort
00159 
00160   subroutine psrssort(nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc,keys,indxl,irnkl,islen,irlen,fposts,gposts,w1)
00161 
00162 
00163     ! Xiaobo Li, Paul Lu, Jonathan Schaeffer,
00164     ! John Shillington, Pok Sze Wong, Hanmao Shi,
00165     ! "On the versatility of parallel sorting by regular sampling",
00166     ! Parallel Computing, volume 19, 1079--1103, Oct 1993.
00167     ! http://www.cs.utoronto.ca/~paullu/Papers/psrs.ps.Z
00168     !
00169     ! sorting articles:
00170     ! http://www.lpac.ac.uk/SEL-HPC/Articles/GeneratedHtml/hpc.sort.html
00171     !
00172     !
00173     !     (C. Mobarry/GSFC, J. Crawford/VSEP)
00174     !
00175     !     Convex SPP-1000 Exemplar MPI implementation
00176     !     Written by C. Mobarry and J. Crawford
00177     !     NASA/GSFC Code 934, Greenbelt MD, 20771
00178     !     Clark.Mobarry@gsfc.nasa.gov, {mobarry,crawford}@maxwell.gsfc.nasa.gov
00179 
00180     implicit none
00181     include 'mpif.h'
00182 
00183     integer :: nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc
00184     integer*8, dimension(nppm) ::  keys, &      ! array of keys to be sorted.
00185                                    w1       ! work array
00186     integer, dimension(nppm) ::    indxl, irnkl ! origin locations of the keys 
00187 
00188 
00189     integer, dimension(nprocs) :: islen, irlen
00190     integer, dimension(nprocs+1) :: fposts, gposts !  fencepost index and key values for shuffle
00191 
00192     integer, parameter :: maxprocs = 1024
00193     integer :: itabr(maxprocs), itabl(maxprocs+1)
00194 
00195     integer*8 :: work(maxprocs*(maxprocs+1))
00196     integer*8 :: fpval(maxprocs+1)
00197     integer :: lmax, ak
00198 
00199     integer*8 :: buf(maxprocs)
00200 
00201     integer :: i,j,k,step, tag1, ierr
00202     integer :: status(MPI_STATUS_SIZE)
00203     integer :: fd, nsamp
00204     character(13) :: cfmt
00205 
00206     fd = 20
00207 
00208     tag1=0
00209 
00210 
00211     !     Independent s  !     Note that indx() is a local index on the process.
00212 
00213 
00214     call indexsort( keys,indxl, np, nppm )   ! Index sort from Num. Rec.
00215 
00216     do i=1,np
00217        w1(i) = keys(indxl(i))
00218     enddo
00219 
00220     !     w1() is now the sorted keys.
00221     !     indxl() is now the local indexes for the sort.
00222 
00223     lmax = w1(np)
00224 
00225     !     Choose nproc evenly spaced values out of every bin.
00226     !     Store them all in work().
00227 
00228     k = 1
00229     step=np/nprocs
00230 
00231     do i=1,nprocs
00232        work(i) = w1(k)
00233        k = k + step
00234     enddo
00235 
00236     !     work(1:nprocs) are the sampled key values for the fenceposts.
00237 
00238     tag1 = tag1 + 1
00239 
00240 
00241     if (iproc .ne. 0) then
00242        call MPI_SEND(work, nprocs, MPI_INTEGER8, 0, tag1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr)
00243     else
00244        do i=1,nprocs-1
00245           call MPI_RECV(buf, nprocs, MPI_INTEGER8, MPI_ANY_SOURCE, tag1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, status, ierr)
00246           do j=1,nprocs
00247              work(status(MPI_SOURCE)*nprocs+j) = buf(j)
00248           enddo
00249        enddo
00250     endif
00251 
00252 
00253     if (iproc .eq. 0) then
00254        !        Insertion sort the fencepost values of keys and indexes.
00255        do i=2,nprocs*nprocs
00256           ak = work(i)
00257           do j=i,2,-1
00258              if (work(j-1) .le. ak) goto 300
00259              work(j) = work(j-1)
00260           enddo
00261           j = 1
00262 300       continue
00263           work(j) = ak
00264        enddo
00265        !        After the insertion sort.
00266        !        work() are the sorted sampled key values for the fenceposts.
00267        nsamp=nprocs*nprocs
00268        cfmt = "(/a15,"//achar(mod(nsamp/10,10)+48) // achar(mod(nsamp,10)+48) // "(i4))"
00269        write(fd,cfmt) 'Sorted sample: ',(work(i),i=1,nsamp)
00270 
00271        k = 1
00272        do i=1,nprocs*nprocs,nprocs
00273           fpval(k) = work(i)
00274           k = k + 1
00275        enddo
00276     endif
00277 
00278     call MPI_BCAST(fpval, nprocs+1, MPI_INTEGER8, 0,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr)
00279 
00280 
00281     fpval(nprocs+1) = lmax+1
00282     write (fd,*) 'Pivots: ',fpval(1:nprocs+1)
00283 
00284     !     Determine segment boundaries. Within each bin, fposts(i) is the
00285     !     start of the ith shuffle segment.
00286     fposts(1) = 1
00287     k = 2
00288     do i=1,np
00289        !        The first element may be greater than several fencepost values,
00290        !        so we must use a do-while loop.
00291        do while (w1(i) .ge. fpval(k))
00292           fposts(k) = i
00293           k = k + 1
00294        enddo
00295     enddo
00296 
00297     !     The last element may not be greater than the last fencepost value, so
00298     !     we must assign an appropriate value to every fencepost past the last.
00299     do i=k,nprocs+1
00300        fposts(i) = np+1
00301     enddo
00302 
00303     !     Every process needs fposts() values from every other process, so we will
00304     !     give each process a copy of all the fposts()s in work().
00305 
00306     do i=1,nprocs
00307        islen(i) = fposts(i+1) - fposts(i)
00308     enddo
00309 
00310     call MPI_ALLTOALL( islen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00311                        irlen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00312                        MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00313 
00314 
00315     !     Make sure that "fposts" and "gposts" are zero based for MPI_ALLTOALLV.
00316     !     fposts and gposts are the addresses of the segment boundaries.
00317     fposts(1) = 0
00318     gposts(1) = 0
00319     do i=1,nprocs
00320        fposts(i+1) = fposts(i) + islen(i)
00321        gposts(i+1) = gposts(i) + irlen(i)
00322     enddo
00323 
00324     npnew = gposts(nprocs+1)
00325 
00326     call MPI_ALLTOALLV(  w1  ,islen,fposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00327                          keys,irlen,gposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00328                          MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00329 
00330 
00331     !     Set up the information for the merge:
00332     do i=1,nprocs+1
00333        itabl(i) = gposts(i)
00334     enddo
00335 
00336     !     Merge the segments within each bin.
00337     call nwaymerge(nppm,npnew,nprocs,keys,irnkl,itabl,itabr,iproc)
00338 
00339   end subroutine psrssort
00340 
00341 
00342 !  ===================================================================================================
00343 
00344 
00345 
00346   subroutine pbalsort(nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc,keys, &
00347        indxl,irnkl, islen,irlen,fposts,gposts,pivot,kw1,wload,key_box,balance,debug,work_local)
00348 
00349 
00350     ! P. Gibbon
00351     !
00352     ! Adapted from: Xiaobo Li, et al.,
00353     ! "On the versatility of parallel sorting by regular sampling",
00354     ! Parallel Computing, volume 19, 1079--1103, Oct 1993.
00355     ! http://www.cs.utoronto.ca/~paullu/Papers/psrs.ps.Z
00356     !
00357     !  Selects pivots according to key distribution across whole range
00358     !  Keys subdivided according to oct-tree structure, avoiding jumps when crossing
00359     !  octant boundaries.
00360     !
00361     !
00362     !
00363 
00364     implicit  none
00365     include 'mpif.h'
00366 
00367     integer, intent(in) :: nppm,np,nprocs,iproc
00368     real*8, intent(in) :: wload(nppm)  ! particle work loads
00369     integer, intent(out) :: npnew
00370     real, intent(in) :: work_local  ! total local work load
00371     integer*8, dimension(nppm) ::  keys, &      ! array of keys to be sorted.
00372                                    kw1,kw2,kred      ! work arrays
00373     integer :: pbin(nppm)
00374     integer, dimension(nppm) ::  indxl, irnkl ! origin locations of the keys 
00375     logical, intent(in) :: debug
00376     integer, intent(in) :: balance
00377     integer*8 :: pivot(nprocs+1)
00378     real :: work1(nppm), work2(nppm)
00379     integer*8, dimension(2) :: key_box
00380     integer, dimension(nprocs) :: islen, irlen
00381     integer, dimension(nprocs+1) :: fposts, gposts !  fencepost index and key values for shuffle
00382     integer :: itabr(nprocs), itabl(nprocs+1)
00383     real :: work_loads(nprocs)
00384     real :: load_correct(nprocs)
00385     integer*8 :: lmax, lmin, key_min, key_max, gkey_min, gkey_max, step ! Key mins and maxes and step size
00386     integer*8 :: step_reduced, key_reduce, pshift
00387     integer*8, parameter :: iplace=8**20
00388 !    integer*8, parameter :: iplace=0
00389     integer ::  ibin, itag
00390     integer :: status(MPI_STATUS_SIZE),ierr
00391     real :: alpha, load_sum, ave_work, f_integral, work_average, load_adjust
00392     integer :: total_work, checksum
00393     integer ::  i,j,k,ipe, iset,fd, nfill, proc_debug, nbin
00394     integer :: level_dist=8, nlev=20, level_strip
00395     integer, parameter :: lev_map=15 ! max level for key distrib
00396     integer*8 :: maxbox
00397     integer, parameter :: maxbin=1000000  ! Max # bins for key distrib
00398     real, dimension(maxbin)  :: f_local, f_global, f_final
00399     integer*8, dimension(maxbin) ::  search_list, retain_list, bin_list
00400     integer, dimension(maxbin) :: index_bin
00401     logical :: finished(maxbin)
00402     integer :: ilev, p, np_left, new_bins, nfbins
00403     character(13) :: cfmt
00404     integer, save :: icall
00405     data icall/0/
00406 
00407 
00408 !    fd = iproc+10
00409     fd=6
00410     itag=0
00411     proc_debug = 0
00412 
00413 !  Make key map for binning - need to put in setup routine 
00414 search_list = 8_8**lev_map  ! place holder
00415 
00416 ! Sort local keys
00417     !     Independent s  !     Note that indx() is a local index on the process.
00418     call indexsort( keys,indxl, np, nppm )   ! Index sort from Num. Rec.
00419 
00420     do i=1,np
00421        kw1(i) = keys(indxl(i))
00422        work1(i) = wload(indxl(i))  ! apply sort to work loads too
00423         kw2(i) = kw1(i)   ! duplicate work arrays
00424         work2(i) = work1(i)
00425         
00426     enddo
00427 
00428     !     kw1 now contains the sorted keys; work1 the sorted loads
00429     !     kw2 the reduced keys
00430     !     indxl is now the local indexes for the sort.
00431 
00432     lmax = kw1(np)   ! local max
00433     lmin = kw1(1)    ! local min
00434 
00435 
00436 
00437     ! Determine global min,max
00438 
00439     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(lmax, gkey_max, 1, MPI_INTEGER8, MPI_MAX,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00440     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(lmin, gkey_min, 1, MPI_INTEGER8, MPI_MIN,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00441 
00442 !  Get actual work loads from previous step
00443 !    call MPI_ALLGATHER(work_local, 1, MPI_REAL, work_loads, 1, MPI_REAL,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )  ! Gather work integrals
00444 !    ave_work=SUM(work_loads(1:nprocs))
00445 
00446 
00447 ! Set min/max limits
00448     key_min = gkey_min
00449     key_max = gkey_max
00450     
00451 ! Shortcut parallel sort if only 1 CPU by raising particles/bin threshold
00452     if (nprocs==1) then
00453        alpha=1.
00454     else
00455        alpha=0.03
00456     endif
00457 
00458     if (debug.and.iproc==proc_debug) then
00459         write (*,'(2(a12,o30,a12,o30/))') &
00460          'local min: ',lmin,' local max: ',lmax, &
00461          'global min: ',gkey_min,' global max: ',gkey_max
00462 
00463     endif
00464 
00465 !  place 8 level 1 boxes on search list
00466    do k = 1,8
00467       search_list(k) = search_list(k) + 8_8**(lev_map-1)*(k-1)
00468       finished(k)=.false.
00469    end do
00470 
00471    np_left = np
00472    nbin = 8
00473    nfbins = 0  ! Final # bins
00474    ilev = 1
00475 
00476 
00477    do while (ilev <= lev_map)
00478 
00479 
00480 ! Find local key distribution within current list of boxes (to level lev_map)
00481 ! Keys reduced to same level as boxes, so just need to count # with same key.
00482 
00483     level_strip = nlev-ilev
00484 
00485     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug ) then
00486 !    if (debug ) then
00487         write(*,'(a4,i4,a40,4i10)') 'PE',iproc,'ilev, level_strip, nbin, np_left: ',ilev, level_strip,nbin,np_left
00488     endif
00489      f_local(1:nbin) = 0.  ! reuse work array
00490      ibin = 1    
00491      p=1
00492      step = 1  ! bin size - keys have been reduced to same level as boxes 
00493 
00494      do while (p .le. np_left .and. ibin .le. nbin)
00495 
00496   ! Strip off lower order bits of particle key to match box level 
00497         key_reduce = 8_8**(lev_map-ilev)*ishft( kw2(p), -3_8*level_strip ) 
00498 
00499 
00500         if (key_reduce == search_list(ibin)) then
00501 
00502 !    if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug ) then
00503 !       write(fd,'(a30,2o30)') 'key, reduced key ',kw2(p), key_reduce
00504 !    endif
00505 ! keys match - update bin count and move on to next particle
00506         if (balance==1) then
00507           f_local(ibin) = f_local(ibin) + work2(p) 
00508         else
00509           f_local(ibin) = f_local(ibin) + 1
00510         endif
00511           pbin(p) = ibin ! remember bin number 
00512           p=p+1
00513         else
00514 ! no match - try next bin
00515           ibin=ibin+1
00516         endif
00517       end do
00518 
00519 
00520     ! Global distrib - must make sure all CPUs participate, even if locally finished
00521 
00522     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(f_local, f_global, nbin, MPI_REAL, MPI_SUM,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00523 
00524     if (ilev==1) ave_work=SUM(f_global(1:nbin))/nprocs
00525 
00526 !    if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug ) then
00527 !       write(fd,*) 'Particles left:',np_left
00528 !       write(fd,*) 'Bins left:',nbin
00529 !       write(fd,'(a30/(i8,o30,f12.1))') 'search list distrib: ',(i,search_list(i),f_global(i),i=1,nbin)
00530 !       write(fd,*) 'Average bin weight',ave_work
00531 !       write(fd,*) 'Threshold bin weight',ave_work*alpha
00532 !    endif
00533 
00534 
00535 !  Analyse global distribution on search list
00536     new_bins=0
00537     ilev=ilev+1  ! New refinement level
00538 
00539     do ibin=1,nbin
00540 
00541         if (f_global(ibin) > ave_work*alpha .and. ilev<lev_map) then
00542            ! bin too heavy: put 8 sub-boxes on new search list
00543             do k=0,7
00544               new_bins=new_bins+1
00545               retain_list(new_bins) = search_list(ibin) + 8_8**(lev_map-ilev)*k
00546             end do
00547 
00548         else if (f_global(ibin) /= 0) then
00549            nfbins=nfbins+1   ! Copy bin onto 'final' list here 
00550            bin_list(nfbins) = search_list(ibin)
00551            f_final(nfbins) = f_global(ibin)
00552            finished(ibin)=.true.
00553         else
00554 !  discard bin if f_global = 0
00555         endif
00556     end do
00557 
00558 ! Make new key list from incompleted bins: pack operation
00559     k=0
00560     do p=1,np_left
00561         if ( .not. finished(pbin(p)) ) then
00562            k=k+1
00563            kw2(k)=kw2(p)
00564            work2(k)=work2(p)
00565         endif
00566     end do
00567     np_left = k
00568 
00569 !  Make new search list
00570     search_list(1:new_bins) = retain_list(1:new_bins)
00571    finished(1:new_bins)=.false.
00572     nbin = new_bins
00573   end do 
00574 
00575   nbin = nfbins
00576 
00577     call indexsort( bin_list,index_bin, nbin, maxbin )   ! Index sort from Num. Rec.
00578 
00579     do i=1,nbin
00580        retain_list(i) = bin_list(index_bin(i))
00581        f_global(i) = f_final(index_bin(i))
00582     enddo
00583 
00584     !     kw1 now contains the sorted keys; work1 the sorted loads
00585     checksum = SUM(f_final(1:nbin))
00586     total_work=ave_work*nprocs
00587 
00588     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug ) then
00589 !    if (iproc==proc_debug ) then
00590        write(fd,*) 'Final # bins/max/level:',nbin,maxbin,lev_map
00591        write(fd,*) 'Average bin weight',ave_work
00592        write(fd,*) 'Threshold bin weight',ave_work*alpha
00593        write(fd,*) 'Total work',total_work
00594        write(fd,*) 'Final checksum:',checksum
00595     endif
00596 
00597        if (balance==0 .and. checksum/=total_work) then
00598          if (iproc==proc_debug) then
00599            write(fd,*) 'Problem with binning - writing out list to bin.out'
00600            open(90,file='bin.out')
00601            write(90,'(a30/(i8,o30,f12.1))') 'final bin list ',(i,retain_list(i),f_global(i),i=1,nbin)
00602            close(90)
00603          endif
00604 !        call closefiles
00605          call MPI_FINALIZE(ierr)
00606          stop
00607        endif
00608 
00609 ! Do cumulative integral of f(ibin) and set pivots where int(f) = iproc/nprocs*N
00610 
00611     f_integral = 0.
00612 !    ave_work = SUM(f_global(1:nbin))/nprocs  ! Average # particles/PE
00613 
00614     ipe=1
00615     pivot(1) = ishft(gkey_min,-3_8*(nlev-lev_map))  ! absolute lowest pivot
00616 
00617     do ibin = 1,nbin
00618        f_integral = f_integral + f_global(ibin)
00619        if (f_integral >= ipe*ave_work ) then  ! If int(f) exceeds multiple of work average, set pivot
00620           ipe=ipe+1
00621           pivot(ipe) = retain_list(ibin)  ! Set next pivot
00622         endif
00623    end do
00624 
00625     pivot(nprocs+1) = ishft(gkey_max,-3_8*(nlev-lev_map))+1  ! absolute highest pivot
00626 
00627 
00628     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug ) then
00629        write (fd,'(a20/(10x,i5,o20))') 'Pivots: ',(i,pivot(i),i=1,nprocs+1)
00630     endif
00631 
00632 !  if (debug .and. icall==0 .and. iproc==proc_debug) then
00633   if (debug .and. icall==0 ) then
00634 !       write(*,*) 'PE ',iproc,'Writing key dist'
00635         open(90,file='fglobal.data')
00636        write(20,'(a30/(i6,2f12.3))') '! Local & global key distributions: ',(i,f_local(i),f_global(i),i=1,nbin)
00637 !       call close(90)
00638   endif
00639 
00640 
00641     !     Determine segment boundaries. Within each bin, fposts(i) is the
00642     !     start of the ith shuffle segment.
00643     ! need reduced keys here
00644 
00645     fposts(1) = 1
00646     k = 2
00647 
00648     do i=1,np
00649        key_reduce = ishft(kw1(i),-3_8*(nlev-lev_map))  ! reduced keys
00650        !        The first element may be greater than several fencepost values,
00651        !        so we must use a do-while loop.
00652        do while (key_reduce .ge. pivot(k) .and. key_reduce .le. pivot(nprocs+1))
00653           fposts(k) = i
00654           k = k + 1
00655           if (k>nprocs+1) then
00656             write(*,*) 'post not found'
00657             write(*,'(a5,o20)') 'key = ',i
00658             write(*,'(a5,o20)') 'fp = ',pivot(k)
00659           endif
00660        enddo
00661     enddo
00662 
00663     !     The last element may not be greater than the last fencepost value, so
00664     !     we must assign an appropriate value to every fencepost past the last.
00665 
00666     do i=k,nprocs+1
00667        fposts(i) = np+1
00668     enddo
00669 
00670     !     Every process needs fposts() values from every other process, so we will
00671     !     give each process a copy of all the fposts()s
00672 
00673     do i=1,nprocs
00674        islen(i) = fposts(i+1) - fposts(i)
00675     enddo
00676 
00677     call MPI_ALLTOALL( islen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00678                        irlen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00679                        MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00680 
00681 
00682     !     Make sure that "fposts" and "gposts" are zero based for MPI_ALLTOALLV.
00683     !     fposts and gposts are the addresses of the segment boundaries.
00684     fposts(1) = 0
00685     gposts(1) = 0
00686     do i=1,nprocs
00687        fposts(i+1) = fposts(i) + islen(i)
00688        gposts(i+1) = gposts(i) + irlen(i)
00689     enddo
00690 
00691     npnew = gposts(nprocs+1)
00692 
00693 
00694 !  Use full keys for swap
00695  call MPI_BARRIER(MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00696     call MPI_ALLTOALLV(  kw1  ,islen,fposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00697                          keys,irlen,gposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00698                          MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00699 !    if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug) then
00700  !      write (*,'(a10,i7/a10/(4i12))') 'npnew: ',npnew, &
00701  !      'posts: ',(fposts(i),gposts(i),islen(i),irlen(i),i=1,nprocs)
00702  !   endif
00703 
00704 
00705     !     Set up the information for the merge:
00706     do i=1,nprocs+1
00707        itabl(i) = gposts(i)
00708     enddo
00709 
00710     !     Merge the segments within each bin.
00711     call nwaymerge(nppm,npnew,nprocs,keys,irnkl,itabl(1:nprocs+1),itabr(1:nprocs),iproc)
00712 
00713     icall = icall + 1          ! update call count
00714   end subroutine pbalsort
00715 
00716 
00717 
00718 ! ========================================================================
00719 
00720 
00721   subroutine pswssort(nppm,np,npnew,nprocs,iproc,keys, &
00722        indxl,irnkl, islen,irlen,fposts,gposts,kw1,wload,key_box,balance,debug)
00723 
00724 
00725     ! P. Gibbon
00726     !
00727     ! Adapted from: Xiaobo Li, et al.,
00728     ! "On the versatility of parallel sorting by regular sampling",
00729     ! Parallel Computing, volume 19, 1079--1103, Oct 1993.
00730     ! http://www.cs.utoronto.ca/~paullu/Papers/psrs.ps.Z
00731     !
00732     !  Selects pivots according to key distribution across whole range
00733     !
00734     ! sorting articles:
00735     ! http://www.lpac.ac.uk/SEL-HPC/Articles/GeneratedHtml/hpc.sort.html
00736     !
00737     !
00738 
00739     implicit  none
00740     include 'mpif.h'
00741 
00742     integer, intent(in) :: nppm,np,nprocs,iproc
00743     real*8, intent(in) :: wload(nppm)  ! particle work loads
00744     integer, intent(out) :: npnew
00745     integer, parameter :: binmult=1000000   !TODO: need to reduce size of f() arrays
00746 !    integer, parameter :: binmult=100000   !TODO: need to reduce size of f() arrays
00747     integer*8, dimension(nppm) ::  keys, &      ! array of keys to be sorted.
00748                                    kw1       ! work array
00749     integer, dimension(nppm) ::  indxl, irnkl ! origin locations of the keys 
00750     logical :: debug
00751     integer, intent(in) :: balance
00752     real :: w2(nppm)
00753     integer*8, dimension(2) :: key_box
00754     integer, dimension(nprocs) :: islen, irlen
00755     integer, dimension(nprocs+1) :: fposts, gposts !  fencepost index and key values for shuffle
00756     integer :: itabr(nprocs), itabl(nprocs+1)
00757     real, save, dimension(binmult)  :: f_local, f_global
00758     integer*8 :: fpval(nprocs+1)
00759     integer*8 :: lmax, lmin, key_min, key_max, gkey_min, gkey_max, step ! Key mins and maxes and step size
00760     integer*8 :: step_reduced
00761     integer :: nbin, ibin, itag
00762     integer :: status(MPI_STATUS_SIZE),ierr
00763     real :: ave_work, f_integral
00764     integer ::  i,j,k, fd, nfill, proc_debug
00765     character(13) :: cfmt
00766 
00767     nbin = binmult  ! must correspond to array size
00768 
00769 !    fd = iproc+10
00770     fd=6
00771     itag=0
00772     proc_debug = 0
00773 
00774     !     Independent s  !     Note that indx() is a local index on the process.
00775     call indexsort( keys,indxl, np, nppm )   ! Index sort from Num. Rec.
00776 
00777     do i=1,np
00778        kw1(i) = keys(indxl(i))
00779        w2(i) = wload(indxl(i))  ! apply sort to work loads too
00780     enddo
00781 
00782     !     kw1 now contains the sorted keys; w2 the sorted loads
00783     !     indxl is now the local indexes for the sort.
00784 
00785     lmax = kw1(np)   ! local max
00786     lmin = kw1(1)    ! local min
00787 
00788     ! Determine global min,max
00789 
00790     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(lmax, gkey_max, 1, MPI_INTEGER8, MPI_MAX,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00791 
00792     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(lmin, gkey_min, 1, MPI_INTEGER8, MPI_MIN,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00793 
00794 
00795     step=(gkey_max - gkey_min)/nbin + 1
00796     step_reduced = (key_box(2) - key_box(1))/nbin + 1
00797 
00798 ! Set min/max limits
00799 !    key_min = key_box(1)
00800 !    key_max = key_box(2)
00801     key_min = gkey_min
00802     key_max = gkey_max
00803     
00804     if (debug.and.iproc==proc_debug) write (*,'(3(a12,z20,a12,z20/),a12,i8,a12,z20)') &
00805          'local min: ',lmin,' local max: ',lmax, &
00806          'global min: ',gkey_min,' global max: ',gkey_max, &
00807          ' box_min: ',key_min,' box_max: ',key_max, &
00808          ' nbin ',nbin,' step', step
00809 
00810     f_local(1:nbin) = 0.0
00811 
00812     ! Find local key distribution
00813     do k=1,np
00814           ! bin inside container limits
00815           ibin = (kw1(k)-key_min)/step + 1
00816           ibin = max(min(ibin,nbin),1)
00817        if (balance==1) then
00818           f_local(ibin) = f_local(ibin) + w2(k)  ! Can include actual force load on particle here
00819        else
00820           f_local(ibin) = f_local(ibin) + 1  ! No load balancing - try to get equal # particles  
00821        endif
00822     enddo
00823 
00824     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug) then
00825        cfmt = "(/a15,"//achar(mod(nbin/100,10)+48)//achar(mod(nbin/10,10)+48) // achar(mod(nbin,10)+48) // "(f12.4))"
00826        write(fd,'(a15/(f12.3))') 'Local key distrib: ',(f_local(i),i=1,nbin,nbin/10)
00827     endif
00828 
00829     ! Global distrib
00830     call MPI_ALLREDUCE(f_local, f_global, nbin, MPI_REAL, MPI_SUM,  MPI_COMM_WORLD, ierr )
00831 
00832     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug) then
00833        write(fd,'(a15/(f12.3))') 'Global key distrib: ',(f_global(i),i=1,nbin,nbin/10)
00834        write(fd,*) 'Checksum, N=SUM(f)=',SUM(f_global(1:nbin))
00835     endif
00836 
00837     ! Do cumulative integral of f(ibin) and set pivots where int(f) = iproc/nprocs*N
00838 
00839     f_integral = 0.
00840     ave_work = SUM(f_global(1:nbin))/nprocs  ! Average # particles/PE
00841     fpval(1) = gkey_min  ! absolute lowest pivot
00842     i=1
00843 
00844     do ibin = 1,nbin
00845        f_integral = f_integral + f_global(ibin)
00846        if (f_integral >= i*ave_work ) then  ! If int(f) exceeds multiple of work average, set pivot
00847           nfill = (f_integral-i*ave_work)/ave_work
00848           if (nfill>0) then 
00849                 write (*,'(a20,i8/a40,i8/a10,f12.3,a10,f12.3)') 'Problem on Processor ',iproc &
00850                 , 'integral jumps by more than work average: nfill= ',nfill &
00851                 , 'increment = ', f_global(ibin), ' ave= ',ave_work
00852 !               open(90,file='fglobal.data')
00853 !               write (90,'((i8,f12.2))') (j,f_global(j),j=1,nbin)
00854 !              close(90)
00855 !              call closefiles
00856                call MPI_ABORT(MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00857                 stop
00858           endif
00859           i=i+1
00860           fpval(i) = key_min + ibin*step  ! Set next highest pivot
00861        endif
00862     end do
00863 
00864     fpval(nprocs+1) = gkey_max+1  ! Set absolute highest pivot
00865 
00866     if (debug .and. iproc==proc_debug) then
00867        write (fd,*) 'Ave work: ',ave_work
00868        write (fd,*) 'f_Integral: ',f_integral
00869        write (fd,'(a10,z20/)') 'key_min:',gkey_min
00870        write (fd,'(a10/(10x,i5,z20))') 'Pivots: ',(i,fpval(i),i=1,nprocs+1)
00871        write (fd,'(/a10,z20)') 'key_max:',gkey_max
00872     endif
00873 
00874     !     Determine segment boundaries. Within each bin, fposts(i) is the
00875     !     start of the ith shuffle segment.
00876     fposts(1) = 1
00877     k = 2
00878     do i=1,np
00879        !        The first element may be greater than several fencepost values,
00880        !        so we must use a do-while loop.
00881        do while (kw1(i) .ge. fpval(k) .and. kw1(i).le.key_max)
00882           fposts(k) = i
00883           k = k + 1
00884           if (k>nprocs+1) then
00885             write(*,*) 'post not found'
00886             write(*,'(a5,o20)') 'key = ',i
00887             write(*,'(a5,o20)') 'fp = ',fpval(k)
00888           endif
00889        enddo
00890     enddo
00891 
00892     !     The last element may not be greater than the last fencepost value, so
00893     !     we must assign an appropriate value to every fencepost past the last.
00894     do i=k,nprocs+1
00895        fposts(i) = np+1
00896     enddo
00897 
00898     !     Every process needs fposts() values from every other process, so we will
00899     !     give each process a copy of all the fposts()s
00900 
00901     do i=1,nprocs
00902        islen(i) = fposts(i+1) - fposts(i)
00903     enddo
00904 
00905     call MPI_ALLTOALL( islen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00906                        irlen,1,MPI_INTEGER, &
00907                        MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00908 
00909 
00910     !     Make sure that "fposts" and "gposts" are zero based for MPI_ALLTOALLV.
00911     !     fposts and gposts are the addresses of the segment boundaries.
00912     fposts(1) = 0
00913     gposts(1) = 0
00914     do i=1,nprocs
00915        fposts(i+1) = fposts(i) + islen(i)
00916        gposts(i+1) = gposts(i) + irlen(i)
00917     enddo
00918 
00919     npnew = gposts(nprocs+1)
00920 
00921 
00922     call MPI_ALLTOALLV(  kw1  ,islen,fposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00923                          keys,irlen,gposts,MPI_INTEGER8, &
00924                          MPI_COMM_WORLD,ierr)
00925     if (debug .and. iproc==57) then
00926 
00927        write (*,'(a10,i7/a10/(4i12))') 'npnew: ',npnew, &
00928        'posts: ',(fposts(i),gposts(i),islen(i),irlen(i),i=1,nprocs)
00929     endif
00930     !     Set up the information for the merge:
00931     do i=1,nprocs+1
00932        itabl(i) = gposts(i)
00933     enddo
00934 
00935     !     Merge the segments within each bin.
00936     call nwaymerge(nppm,npnew,nprocs,keys,irnkl,itabl(1:nprocs+1),itabr(1:nprocs),iproc)
00937 
00938   end subroutine pswssort
00939 
00940 
00941   subroutine nwaymrg(nppm,np,nprocs,keys,irnkl,itabl,itabr,me)
00942 
00943     implicit none
00944     integer :: nppm,np,nprocs,me
00945     integer :: irnkl(nppm)
00946     integer*8 :: keys(nppm)
00947     integer :: itabl(nprocs+1),itabr(nprocs)
00948 
00949     integer, parameter :: maxprocs=1024
00950     integer*8 :: ik,itabk(nprocs+1)
00951     integer :: i,j,k,il,ir,ij,irnkj(nprocs+1),jprocs
00952 
00953     !     Make sure that the indicies are "one" baised.
00954     if (itabl(1) .ne. 1) then
00955        do i=nprocs+1,1,-1
00956           itabl(i) = itabl(i) - itabl(1) + 1
00957        enddo
00958     endif
00959 
00960     do i=1,nprocs
00961        itabr(i) = itabl(i+1) - 1
00962     enddo
00963 
00964 !    if (me.eq.57) then
00965 !       write(*,'(2i10)') (i,itabl(i),i=1,nprocs+1)
00966 !    endif
00967 
00968     do j=1,nprocs
00969        itabk(j) = keys(itabl(j))
00970        irnkj(j) = j
00971     enddo
00972 
00973     !     Check for empty segments and remove them.
00974     jprocs = nprocs
00975     i = 1
00976     do j=1,nprocs
00977        if (itabl(irnkj(i)) .gt. itabr(irnkj(i))) then
00978           jprocs = jprocs - 1
00979           do k=i,jprocs
00980              irnkj(k) = irnkj(k+1)
00981           enddo
00982        else
00983           i = i + 1
00984        endif
00985     enddo
00986 
00987     !     Sort the N-way merging table:
00988     do j=2,jprocs
00989        !        Consider each of the original elements in turn.
00990        ij = irnkj(j)
00991        ik = itabk(ij)
00992        !           and look for a place to insert it
00993        !           The slot "j" is now empty.
00994        do i=j-1,1,-1
00995           if(itabk(irnkj(i)) .le. ik) goto 202
00996           irnkj(i+1) = irnkj(i)
00997        enddo
00998        i=0
00999 202    continue
01000        irnkj(i+1) = ij
01001     enddo
01002     !     The merging table is now in sorted order.
01003 
01004 
01005     !     proceed with the merge
01006     do i=1,np
01007 
01008        !        Remove the smallest element from the merging list.
01009        ij = irnkj(1)
01010 
01011        !        refresh the merge table
01012        il = itabl(ij) + 1
01013        ir = itabr(ij)
01014        ik = keys(il)
01015        itabk(ij) = ik
01016        itabl(ij) = il
01017        irnkl(il-1) = i
01018 
01019        !        pick out each element in turn
01020 
01021        !        The first slot is now empty.
01022        if( ir .ge. il ) then
01023           !           look for the slot to insert the new data.
01024           do j=1,jprocs-1
01025              if(itabk(irnkj(j+1)) .ge. ik) goto 203
01026              irnkj(j) = irnkj(j+1)
01027           enddo
01028           j=jprocs
01029 203       continue
01030           irnkj(j) = ij
01031        else
01032           !           retire a slot
01033           jprocs = jprocs-1
01034           do j=1,jprocs
01035              irnkj(j) = irnkj(j+1)
01036           enddo
01037        endif
01038     enddo
01039 
01040   end subroutine nwaymrg
01041 
01042 
01043   !  ================================
01044   !
01045   !         SORT_HEAP
01046   !
01047   !     Sort 64-bit integer array into ascending order
01048   !     using heap-sort algorithm
01049   !    (Numerical Recipes f90, p1171)
01050   !
01051   !  ================================
01052 
01053   subroutine sort_i(iarr)
01054     implicit none
01055     integer*8, intent(inout) :: iarr(:)
01056     integer :: i,n
01057 
01058     n = size(iarr)
01059 
01060 
01061     do i=n/2,1,-1                      ! Left range - hiring phase (heap creation)
01062        call sift_down(i,n)
01063     end do
01064 
01065     do i=n,2,-1                        ! Right range of sift-down is decr. from n-1 ->1
01066        ! during retirement/promotion (heap selection) phase.
01067        call swap( iarr(1),iarr(i) )      ! Clear space at end of array and retire top of heap into it
01068        call sift_down( 1,i-1)
01069     end do
01070 
01071   contains
01072     subroutine sift_down(l,r)        ! Carry out the sift-down on element arr(l) to maintain 
01073       integer, intent(in) :: l,r     ! the heap structure
01074       integer :: j,jold    ! index
01075       integer*8 :: a
01076 
01077       a = iarr(l)
01078 
01079       jold = l
01080       j = l + l
01081       do                   ! do while j <= r
01082          if (j > r) exit
01083          if (j < r) then
01084             if (iarr(j) < iarr(j+1)) j = j+1
01085          endif
01086          if (a >= iarr(j)) exit       ! Found a's level, so terminate sift-down
01087          iarr(jold) = iarr(j)
01088          jold = j                    ! Demote a and continue
01089          j = j+j
01090       end do
01091       iarr(jold) = a                  ! Put a into its slot
01092 
01093     end subroutine sift_down
01094 
01095   end subroutine sort_i
01096 
01097 
01098 !  Index sort for 8-byte integer list
01099 
01100   subroutine indsort_i8(iarr,list,n,nppm)
01101     implicit none
01102 
01103     integer, intent(in) :: n,nppm
01104 
01105     integer*8, dimension(nppm), intent(in) :: iarr
01106     integer, dimension(nppm), intent(inout) :: list
01107     integer :: i, indxt, ir, l, j
01108     integer*8 :: q
01109 
01110     list(1:n) =  (/ (i,i=1,n) /)  
01111 
01112     if(n==1) return
01113     l= n/2 + 1
01114     ir = n
01115 
01116     do
01117        if (l>1) then
01118           l=l-1
01119           indxt = list(l)
01120           q = iarr(indxt)
01121        else
01122           indxt = list(ir)
01123           q = iarr(indxt)
01124           list(ir) = list(1)
01125           ir = ir - 1
01126           if (ir == 1) then
01127              list(1) = indxt
01128              return
01129           endif
01130        endif
01131 
01132        i = l
01133        j = l+l
01134        do while (j <= ir)
01135           if (j < ir) then
01136              if (iarr(list(j)) < iarr(list(j+1)) ) j=j+1
01137           endif
01138           if (q < iarr(list(j)) ) then
01139              list(i) = list(j)
01140              i=j
01141              j=j+j
01142           else
01143              j = ir+1
01144           endif
01145        end do
01146        list(i) = indxt
01147     end do
01148 
01149   end subroutine indsort_i8
01150 
01151 
01152 !  Index sort for 4-byte integer list
01153 
01154   subroutine indsort_i4(iarr,list,n,nppm)
01155     implicit none
01156 
01157     integer, intent(in) :: n,nppm
01158 
01159     integer, dimension(nppm), intent(in) :: iarr
01160     integer, dimension(nppm), intent(inout) :: list
01161     integer :: i, indxt, ir, l, j
01162     integer :: q
01163 
01164     list(1:n) =  (/ (i,i=1,n) /)  
01165 
01166     if(n==1) return
01167     l= n/2 + 1
01168     ir = n
01169 
01170     do
01171        if (l>1) then
01172           l=l-1
01173           indxt = list(l)
01174           q = iarr(indxt)
01175        else
01176           indxt = list(ir)
01177           q = iarr(indxt)
01178           list(ir) = list(1)
01179           ir = ir - 1
01180           if (ir == 1) then
01181              list(1) = indxt
01182              return
01183           endif
01184        endif
01185 
01186        i = l
01187        j = l+l
01188        do while (j <= ir)
01189           if (j < ir) then
01190              if (iarr(list(j)) < iarr(list(j+1)) ) j=j+1
01191           endif
01192           if (q < iarr(list(j)) ) then
01193              list(i) = list(j)
01194              i=j
01195              j=j+j
01196           else
01197              j = ir+1
01198           endif
01199        end do
01200        list(i) = indxt
01201     end do
01202 
01203   end subroutine indsort_i4
01204 
01205 
01206 
01207   subroutine swap_ab(p,q)
01208     integer*8 :: p,q, dum
01209     dum = p
01210     p=q
01211     q = dum
01212   end subroutine swap_ab
01213 
01214 
01215 
01216 
01217 ! Removes duplicate entries from key list
01218  
01219   subroutine uniq8(key, ntot)
01220     integer :: ntot, nu
01221     integer*8, dimension(ntot+1) :: key
01222     nu=0
01223     do i=1,ntot
01224        if (key(i) /= key(i+1) ) then
01225           nu=nu+1
01226           key(nu) = key(i) ! pack
01227        endif
01228     end do
01229     ntot=nu
01230   end subroutine uniq8

01233 
01234 end module tree_utils
